hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Asim ibn Bahdilah: Abu Wail visited al-Aswad ibn Hilal to see him. Abu Wail said: 'By Allah, I did not come to you until I wished not to meet you.' (al-Aswad) said: 'Why O Abu Wail?' He said: 'Because I prevent you from life, and I fear for you the trials/afflictions, and I know what is with Allah is better.' (al-Aswad) said: 'Do not do this O Abu Wail, for I am not disinterested in fifty prayers every day. When I die, my deed ceases. I have not increased in prayer a prayer, nor in a good deed a good deed, nor in fasting a fast.'

hadiths.english_translation: When Abu Wail died, Abu Burdah kissed his forehead. It is mentioned that Abu Wail died during the time of al-Hajjaj after the slaughter campaigns. Abu Wail narrated from Umar, Ali, Abdullah, Usama ibn Zayd, Hudhayfah, Abu Musa, Ibn Abbas, Azzah ibn Qais. He went to the Levant and heard from Abu al-Darda'. He narrated from Ibn al-Zubayr, Salman ibn Rabi'ah, participated in the expedition to Balanjar with Salman ibn Rabi'ah, narrated from Ibn Mu'ayz al-Sa'di. He also narrated from Masruq, Kurdus, Amr ibn Sharhabil, Yasar ibn Numayr, Salamah ibn Subrah, and Amr ibn al-Harith (who narrated from Zaynab wife of Abdullah). He was reliable and abundant in hadith. Narrated by Wakee' ibn al-Jarrah from al-A'mash from Abu Wail from al-Subay' ibn Mu'abbad al-Juhani.

Second - I saw Zaid ibn Wahb dyeing his beard with yellow. Our companions said: Zaid ibn Wahb died during the rule of al-Hajjaj after the slaughter campaigns, and he was reliable and abundant in hadith.

hadiths.english_translation: Abu Ma'mar (with the kunya Abu Ma'mar) narrated from Umar, Ali, Abdullah, Abu Mas'ud, and Alqamah. There is a narration through Isra'il from Abu Ma'mar that he heard Abu Bakr al-Siddiq saying: Disbelief in Allah is claiming a lineage not known, but this is not firmly established with me. Three chains follow: First - When Umar bowed (in prayer), he placed his hands on his knees. Second - He used to narrate a hadith and would commit an error in it, following what he had heard. Third - Abu Ma'mar died in Kufa during the rule of Ubaidullah ibn Ziyad, and he was reliable with many hadiths.
